description: Edge cases and boundary conditions for loops

input.natural_language: Loop over empty array (should not execute body)

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:set name="empty" type="array" value="[]" />
Before loop
<q:loop type="array" var="item" items="{empty}">
  This should not appear
</q:loop>
After loop
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Outputs: Before loop\nAfter loop (body never executes)

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:set name="single" type="array" value="['only']" />
<q:loop type="array" var="item" items="{single}">
  Item: {item}
</q:loop>

input.natural_language: Range loop where from > to (no iterations)

expected_output.quantum_code:
Before
<q:loop type="range" var="i" from="10" to="5">
  This won't execute
</q:loop>
After
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Outputs: Before\nAfter (no iteration when from > to)

input.natural_language: List loop with empty string (single empty item)

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:set name="emptyStr" value="" />
<q:loop type="list" var="item" items="{emptyStr}">
  Item: [{item}]
</q:loop>
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Outputs: Item: [] (one iteration with empty string)

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:set name="count" type="number" value="0" />
<q:loop type="range" var="i" from="1" to="1000">
  <q:set name="count" operation="increment" />
</q:loop>
Processed: {count} items
